title: Strengthening Medical Practical Competencies: History-Based STEAM Maker Game Learning: Age of Exploration

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Historical Knowledge (Age of Exploration), Fundamental STEAM Concepts, and Digital Tool Utilization Skills
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Analyze historical events by integrating STEAM elements (geography, mathematics, physics)
Design and implement creative problem-solving strategies through game-based task resolution

Learners can complete a 4-week interdisciplinary healthcare/nursing task (e.g., patient simulation case) using team collaboration (role division: doctor-nurse-physical therapist) and competitive strategies (efficient resource allocation compared to other teams) and achieve 80 or more points on a performance evaluation rubric (30% task completeness, 30% collaboration efficiency, 40% innovation).

Learners can design two 3D models or circuit prototypes reflecting the historical development of healthcare/nursing using digital fabrication tools (e.g., Tinkercad, Fusion 360, Eagle) and achieve an average score of 80 or higher across functionality (40%), historical accuracy (30%), and creativity (30%) based on expert evaluation criteria.

Learners can design problem-solving solutions in a healthcare-technology convergence project (e.g., digital healthcare solution development) using three or more critical thinking techniques (e.g., SWOT analysis, 5Why analysis) and two or more computational thinking tools (e.g., algorithm design, data visualization) and achieve a grade of B or higher in four out of five project evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
